text: Mooi donker (zwart) bier met dikke compacte mokkakleurige schuimkraag die langzaam inzakt. Aroma : eik, hout, licht vineus, rood fruit. Volle ronde smaak, licht alcoholisch. Lange warme, zoete afdronk, tinteling op het tandvlees. Deze valt in de categorie sipper. Subliem.

33cl Bottle from Uiltje Taproom. Black colour, beige-brown head. Aroma of liquorice, roasted malts, warming alcohol, a bit of red fruits, quite sweet. Flavour is sweet but not overly so, roasted malts, red fruits, alcohol, some molasses, a bit of salmiak, liquorice, caramel, firm bitter finish. Full bodied. Nice and balanced.

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2017 Zwart, bruine schuimkraag die snel inzakt naar een laagje, weinig koolzuur, olieachtig laagje langs het glas. Aroma: Donkere geroosterde mouten, chocolade, zoethout, vanile, karamel, zoete bessen, zoetig en alcohol/Whisky. Smaak: Zwaar geroosterde mout, zoet, rood fruit, rode bessen (zuurtje), hout/Oak, whisky, vanille  en flink alcohol warmte. De bitter is behoorlijk maar door de zoet en alcohol toch iets op de achtergrond. In de nasmaak wel mooie hop tonen met veel fruitighid. Een stevige alcohol warmte en wat koffie en chocolade hinten die in de nasmaak doorkomen.Volle body, dik en romig mondgevoel, iets olieachtig.  Afdronk is zoet, plakkerig en alcoholisch.  Genieten...... heel rustig!
Bottle 0,33ltr: Black colored brew with an kind of dry bitter taste, hints of salty liquorice, espresso, chocolate and alcoholic boozyness. The 16,1% drinks very easy but thake caution.

Bottle shared during the TST/TWAT tasting. Pours black with a small tan head. Lots of roasted malts, very boozy as expected, dark berries, licorice, slightly burnt wood. Over medium sweet, medium bitter, a bit of berry tartness and quite some booze. Dry finish. Over medium body and low carbonation. The ABV is just a bit silly on this one.

TST/TWAT. Bottle shared at svartvits black with light tan head. Deep dark roasted chocolate malts, burnt. Fruitiness and ash. Moderate sweet and more bitter. Full body, low carbonation. Dry and alcoholic.

Bottle shared at The Sweetest Tasting. Black with small light brown head. Cocoa, espresso, quite some alcohol, red currant, earthy tobacco notes, soft licorice. Medium sweet, under medium bitter and decent sour kick at the end. Over medium bodied with alcoholic dry finish. Surprisingly nice for the abv
LCI. Poured from the bottle. Damn, had this one for about a year, but it has aged with grace: roasted malt, lots of hop and red fruit, full bodied Very, very good!
Zwart met mooie bruine kraag. Aroma whiskey, as, donker fruit en hout. Smaak evenzo met wat chocolade. Erg lekker.

33cl bottle at home from Biernavigatie.nl. Nose is dark barriers, bourbon, roasty. Body is black, head is small, brownish, creamy, mostly diminishing, good lacing. Aroma is herbs, chocolate liquor, old wood, rotten leaves, black tea, tobacco, bourbon, dried fruits, licorice, mild coffee, sour cherry. Medium sweet, heavy bitter, light to medium fruity sour. Finish is long lasting roasty fruity medium bittersweet, light fruity sour, medium alcohol warmth. Full body, oily to dry texture, soft carbonation. Quite heavy, strong flavor, very complex, well balanced, strong but wouldnt say its 16%, great one.

Peu de souvenirs vu que je lai bue dans un état débriété assez avancé.
De mémoire : très noir, très puissant. Nez ultra éthylique mais bien plus doux en bouche. Ultra torréfiée/pétrole mais reste assez rond et porté sur quelques fruits noirs.

Bottled, not sure where i got it from. Dark brown colored, brown head. Extremely complex nose, roasted malts, licorice, vanilla, wood, molasses, boozy, wow. Smooth and complex flavor, roasted malts, vanilla, wood, licorice. Very complex, with the only possible downside that its pretty alcoholic. Great work!

UPDATED: SEP 25, 2016 Boxed bottle at home: nice design. Pitch black, brown foamy head. Incredibly rich roasted malty dark chocolate, cacao, espresso, dried fruits, vinous red fruitiness, vanilla, big boozy alcoholic heath in the finish alongside quite a hoppy-bitter note, light leather. Lingering roasted malty vs red fruity, bittersweet aftertaste. Huge body, low carbonation, velvety soft, sticky mouthfeel. This matches the big USA stouts!

Bottle 0.33l from Cika Jan Amsterdam, The Netherlands. 14.07.2016. Taste with Zlotta. Pour it dark color with small black head. Aroma dark chocolate, lots of red fruits. Taste of roasted malt, red fruits, tart, licorice, good hidden alcohol, nice chocolate finish, really good balanced, full body, thick feel, soft carbonation, long finish. Perfect!

33cl bottle split thanks to SimonBlok. Pours a pitch black colour with a small mocca brouwn head which swiftly diminishes to a thin layer, mostly on the glass. Rich aroma of plums, raisins, dark chocolate, bit of wiener melange, alcohol, coffee beans, candy sugar, port, liquorice. Taste is fairly sweet, light bitter but that kicks in the finish with a dry sensation on the back of the tongue. Notes of dark malts, caramel, plums, raisins, slight burnt sugar, espresso, dark chocolate, hint of oak, red fruit, mocca, alcohol, pear. Texture is sticky to oily, full bodied with soft carbonation.

33cl bottle split with Gyhallmanti. Appearance: pitch black with low light brown head. Leaves good lacing on the side of the glass, as well as tears of wine, due to the high alcohol content. Aroma: coffee, dark chocolate, plums, raisin, port, red wine, red fruits. Boozy. Taste: high sweetness and high bitterness. Dry bitter finish. Notes of espresso, dark chocolate, raisins, tannins. Quite warming, very complex. Palate: heavy bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation.
Bottle at home. Pours black, nose is caramel, toffee, biscuit, chocolate, taste is sweet, rich, berries, caramel, roasted.
Bottle at cropredy 2016 day 2... Dark black.. Thin tan lacing.. Soft meaty... Bih Berries nose.. Dark chocolate roast.... Rich heavy roast chocolate roast

Bottle from Bierboetiek De Zythotheek, Valkenburg, consumed in a field at Fairports Annual Reunion Festival, Cropredy Friday 12th August 2016   Pours black in colour with hardly any head to speak of. Fruity and malty with a good dose of liquorice on the nose. Malty in the mouth, the considerable strength ensures that the oomph factor is high and there is an immediate warmth from the alcohol, though it doesnt sidetrack matters. Choc, liquorice and a creamy oakiness. Its a very good beer. A7 A4 T8 P5 Ov15 3.9

33cl. Bottle. 
Pours black with tan head. 
Aroma red fruits, chocolate, alcohol, caramel, coffee, raisin, dark fruits. 
Taste chocolate caramel fruity sweets, roasted bitter, little sour. 
Mouthfeel thick, oily. 
Awesome beer.

Bottle from Deconinck, Vichte - BE. Color: deep dark black beer with no carbonation and small brown head. Smell: roasted malt, caramel with plums and red grapes. Raisin. Alcohol notes. Taste: medium/full body with good roasted malt, raisin and plums with raspberry jam notes and black chocolate. Effervescence on mouth. Aftertaste: caramel, roasted malt, porto notes. Red fruits, plums and grapes. Alcohol finish. Bitterness. Sweet alcohol. Interesting.

Good resistant head, dark beige, over jet-black beer. Sour, whisky-like, as a whisky-sour indeed. Lactic acid, spruce. Light acidity in the mouth, lactic, sour cream, roast, whisky. Rich flavour - but absolutely doesnt give a 16+% impression... Nice, even if it hasnt % ABV.  Thanks to Louis!

Bottle @ ZZT 2016-1, small sample. Thanks all for sharing! Dark color, short frothy head. Aroma of big chocolate, some coffee, oak, vanilla. Dry in taste, licorice. Toffee. Bit too much booze unfortunately.

Thank you Benzai! 330 ml. bottle sampled @ ZZT 2016-1. Dark red brown, little head. Nose is rather alcoholic (no surprise), licorice, umami, herbal, thick molasses, syrup de Liege, apple & licorice. Rather umami & licorice forward, there is sweetness & quite a lot of it which I am digging. Body is akin to flat syrup, sugar & cuberdons. Taste is licorice, flat, herbal, molasses, umami, upfront, luckily the finish carries red fruits, which balance the whole & save the beer, warming but not a much as you would expect. Fruit really helps it turning it into a pleasant sipper. Low oxidation evident. Bit too licorice, flat etc. to fully shine still. I liked the Ardmore BA version quite a bit more surprisingly.

Pitch black colour, beige head. Alcoholic aroma, brown sugar, caramel, vanilla, cacao, roasted malts. Sweet malty flavour, red fruits, alcohol. Finish alcohol, red fruits. Bit too alcoholic.(from 33cL bottle @ ZZT 2016-1. Thanks for sharing, Benzai!)

Sampled from bottle @ ZZT 2016-1. Opaque black color, small beige head. Aroma is malts, liquor, liquorice, wood, Nice aroma, but the flavor is too alcoholic for me to really like it. Gets in the way of other flavors. Over the top.
Bottle @ ZZT 2016-1. Black colour with a small off-white head. Smells alcohol, sweet, chocolate. Tastes alcohol, sweet, roasty. Pretty heavy. Full body, soft carbo, warming.

28/VI/16 - 12Fl. Oz. bottle from Bierhalle Deconinck (Vichte) @ the pre-AdamChandler-tasting, Erwins ponton - BB: n/a, bottled: 18/VIII/15 (2016-711) Thanks to Erwin for sharing the bottle!
Clear dark brown to almost black beer, small very big bubbled head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: bit smelly, cheesy, sweet, dried fruits, sugary touch, caramel, alcohol. MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. Taste: sourish start, pretty sweet, lots of dried fruits, some tannins. Aftertaste: caramel, very fruity, bit cheesy, soft roast.

0.33 l bottle from Dranken Melgers, shared with markoijelena. Pitch black with a brown head. Sweetish-malty, moderately roasty and a little bit alcoholic aroma of dark chocolate, some coffee, licorice, some tar and hints of dark ripe fruits. Sweetish-malty, moderately roasty and a little fruity taste of dark chocolate, some coffee, licorice, hints of tar and some red fruits, followed by a medium long, slightly roasty-bitter, a little warming-alcoholic finish. Medium to full body, slightly oily mouthfeel, flat. Nice, but not as good as expected. Lacks some complexity and also mouthfeel (moaning on a high level though).

schenkt stroperig zwart in met minimale kraag. aroma is zwaar zoet, alcoholisch, vanille, geroosterde mout, melkchocolade, volmoutig. smaken zijn vrij dik, redelijk aan de bittere kant, scherp alcoholisch, donkere chocolade, geroosterde mout, kersen (licht), drop, koffie, geweldig dat dikke mondgevoel, en de zoetheid, maar voor de rest wat té bitter, en is voor mij wat onaf (niet helemaal gebalanceerd).
Bottle at Erwin's Place, thanks Erwin! Nose is cheese, bit old, chocolate. Taste is lots of red fruit, chocolate, roast. Bomb!

I was a little shocked when I was pouring this in a tasting glass: so dark, almost siropy, a little bit of a chocolate brown head.
A full sweet taste, the hints of red fruits very noticable. Also quite fresh, maybe because of the hops used. And then the wonderful hint of coffee in its aftertaste.
A frighting ABV, but well worth the tasting.
0,33l fles gedeeld met lion donker bruin met een bruine kraag. Geur is basterd suiker met gefermenteerd fruit smaak is balsamico en rode bessen ook bramen in de afdronk . Heftig spul qua alcohol

Bottle shared. Black with pretty much no head. Aroma of oak, licorice, caramel, red fruits, dark chocolate, booze, alcohol and roast. Flavour is heavy sweet and moderate to heavy bitter. Full bodied with soft carbonation. A little young, alcoholic and unbalanced.

33cl bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis.
No head. Clear almost black pour. Lots of alcohol. Very good. A bit young though.
Bottle. Black. Malt, roast, licorice and red fruit in the aroma. Very sweet. caramel. Alcoholic. Syrupy mouthfeel Tasty, warming and powerful.

Bottle: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Black beer with a thin brown head.
Aroma is rich and dark: roast, tar, red fruit, liquorice, tobacco, molasses, coal...
Flavour has many liquorice ans bay leaf tones, which after smelling this beer I didnt really think about. Alcohol burn, roast, bitter, light molasses, tar, wood roast/coal, hint of red fruit in the back (not enough), liquor...
Aftertaste is bitter, roast, rye, wood roast/coal, tar...
Low carbo, creamy alcohol burning mouthfeel, full bodied.
Good but not deep!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
Immense imperial porter. Loaded with hops giving citrus fruits, resin and bitterness. Fruitiness from the red fruits. Vanilla and tannins from the oak. Chocolate, coffee, roasted malts and licorice. All still in balance, although this is a beast. But a nice beast it is!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma:

Heavy aroma of malts, caramel, wood, vanilla, liquorice, dark fruit, chocolate and roasted malts.

Appearance:

Opaque black beer with a slight/medium brown/dark brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, wood, vanilla, liquorice, dark fruit and chocolate; ends slightly bitter with roasted malts.

Overall:

An intense and dark beer with a complex aroma and flavour. Shame that the head diminishes so fast, also the palate could have been more thick.

330 ml bottle. Pours black with light head. Aromas of sweet dark fruit and smooth dark malts. Rich flavors of same with a creamy dark chocolate in the mix. A definite alcohol presence but not distracting. This is as imperial as it gets but a Porter? I dont know. Beauty!

Bottle, pours black with a tan head. Liquorice, dark chocolate, brown malt, red berries, herbs, orange peel, wood, bit of peat, or is that the extreme booziness? Sweet, with a good amount of bitterness, full body, creamy to sticky, low carbonation. Ever lasting boozy, fruity, dark chocolate finish. Despite (?) the booziness, it is really a tasteful beer. Hold it in your mouth for a while for even more taste. I expected mainly booze, but theres much more to it.

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2016 33cl bottle shared. Appearance: Pitch black with a brown ring.
Aroma:Mollases, Dark fruit, roasted malts
Taste: Sweet, Mollases, with some dark bitter roasted tones and some fruityness. Roasted malts, chocolate,coffee, booze, caramel,ripe red and dark fruits Quite complext and boozy reminds me of Tokyo/Black /Horizon in a good way.
Full thick viscous body with low carbonation. 

Great sipper .

33cl bottle at home. Pitch black with a small tan head. Full body with low carbonation. Quite sweet with subtle bitter tones. Chocolate, booze, coffee, roasted malts, caramel, ripe fruits and spices. A taste bomb!

33cl bottle at home, poured a black colour with a tanned ring on top. lots of different flavours in the nose, lots of deep forrest fruits, combined with a lot of salty english liqorice. caramel, sweet chocolate, wooden notes, slight vinous fruit, bitter aftertaste, medium bodied mouthfeel for the insane alcohol level. dangeoursly drinkable. a bit over the top for me

Bottle at tasting. Black pour. Aroma of licorice, red ripe fruit and mild oak. Smooth taste of mild smoke, subtle tart red fruit, soft oak, creamy choco and subtle whisky. Very balanced and tasty. Good stuff.
